author: Irene Savio
title: El Vaticà suspèn l'agenda del Papa almenys fins diumenge
text:
Església
El Vaticà suspèn l’agenda del Papa almenys fins diumenge
Segons fonts del Vaticà, l’audiència jubilar de dissabte ha sigut cancel·lada, així com la missa del jubileu dels diaques de diumenge
Francesc ha passat una «nit tranquil·la» i aquest matí s’ha «dedicat a la lectura d’alguns diaris»
Última hora de la salut del papa Francesc, avui en directe: quina malaltia té i evolució a l’hospital
El Papa pateix un quadre clínic «complex» i estarà hospitalitzat «el temps adequat»
Després de passar una nit «tranquil·la», el Vaticà ha informat aquest matí que el papa Francesc, de 88 anys, ha suspès la seva agenda d’activitats fins com amínim diumenge a causa de la infecció respiratòria per la qual divendres passat va ser hospitalitzat.
D’aquesta manera, l’audiència jubilar de dissabte ha sigut cancel·lada. I, en el mateix sentit, la missa del jubileu dels diaques, que se celebrarà diumenge, ha sigut delegada al cardenal italià Rino Fisichella, proprefecte del Dicasteri per a l’Evangelització.
Notícies relacionadesFora d’això, el portaveu vaticà ha explicat aquest dimarts a les 12.30 hores que, en la mateixa línia que els dies anteriors, el Papa ha descansat durant la nit, ha esmorzat i s’ha «dedicat a la lectura d’alguns diaris». A la tarda hi haurà un nou comunicat mèdic.
Quadre clínic complex
El Papa ha imposat un gran hermetisme al voltant de la seva hospitalització. Amb prou feines se sap que el Pontífex, que en els últims dies havia passat una grip, pateix una infecció respiratòria «polibacteriana» que l’ha obligat a canviar de medicació dues vegades en els últims dies. En els informes de dilluns, també es va informar que no té febre, tot i que el quadre clínic és «complex».

author: rbksa
title: Iraq stun favorites Japan to reach Asian Cup last 16
text:
DOHA: Aymen Hussein scored two first-half headers as Iraq stunned Asian Cup favorites Japan 2-1 on Friday to reach the knockout rounds.
It was Japan’s first Asian Cup group-stage defeat in 26 matches and set them on a potential collision course with South Korea in the last 16 in Qatar, assuming they still progress.
Iraq — ranked 63 in the world to Japan’s 17 — endured a nervous finish after Liverpool’s Wataru Endo pulled one back in the third of eight minutes of injury time.
But they held on and now have six points after beating Indonesia 3-1 in their opening match.
They play Vietnam in their final group game on Wednesday.
Four-time champions Japan have three points after beating Vietnam 4-2 in their opener and face Indonesia, also on Wednesday.
Hajjime Moriyasu’s side went into the game in Doha on the back of a 10-game winning streak in which they scored 43 goals.
But they had no answer for Iraq’s power and aggression, backed by the support of almost 40,000 in the crowd.
Japan had a penalty award rightly overturned by VAR in the second half.
Moriyasu’s team were again missing injured Brighton winger Kaoru Mitoma, who was not named in the matchday squad.
Takefusa Kubo, who has scored six goals for Real Sociedad this season, started after coming off the bench against Vietnam.
Hussein was one of five changes in the Iraq starting lineup, coming into the side after scoring as a substitute against Indonesia.
The striker wasted little time in getting on the scoresheet again, heading home after Japan goalkeeper Zion Suzuki flapped at a cross.
Japan had made a similarly slow start against Vietnam, conceding two first-half goals before turning things around before the break.
But they found Iraq far tougher and failed to create any clear-cut chances for the rest of the first half.
Instead it was Iraq who scored again in injury time, Hussein holding off Hiroki Ito to nod home from close range.
Japan brought on Takehiro Tomiyasu at the break for the Arsenal defender’s first appearance of the tournament.
Japan won a penalty in the 56th minute when Rebin Solaka was adjudged to have tripped Takuma Asano.
But a VAR check revealed the tackle to have been a clean one, and Ritsu Doan was also out of luck when he curled a free kick over the bar less than 10 minutes later.
Substitute Mohanad Ali almost gave Iraq a third goal midway through the second half but his shot rolled agonizingly wide of the post.
Endo gave Japan hope when he pulled one back deep in injury time but it was too late.
Iraq stun favorites Japan to reach Asian Cup last 16
https://arab.news/4yhvk
Iraq stun favorites Japan to reach Asian Cup last 16
- It was Japan’s first Asian Cup group-stage defeat in 26 matches
- Iraq held on and now have six points after beating Indonesia 3-1 in their opening match
DOHA: Aymen Hussein scored two first-half headers as Iraq stunned Asian Cup favorites Japan 2-1 on Friday to reach the knockout rounds.

author: Nate Stanley
title: Greenville County removing tree debris for free
text:
ZIP Advertisement Crews hard at work pulling tree debris from the sides of Greenville roads Over the next few weeks crews from around the U.S. will be in our area cleaning up damage left by Hurricane Helene
Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 11:18 PM EDT Oct 3, 2024 Nate Stanley Reporter Crews hard at work pulling tree debris from the sides of Greenville roads Over the next few weeks crews from around the U.S. will be in our area cleaning up damage left by Hurricane Helene
Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 11:18 PM EDT Oct 3, 2024 INTO RUTHERFORD AND BUNCOMBE COUNTIES TO HELP THOUSANDS OF WORKERS ARE SPREAD THROUGHOUT OUR REGION, FOCUSED ON BRINGING POWER BACK AND CLEANING UP AFTER HELENE STANLEY SPENT THE AFTERNOON WITH THE GREENVILLE COUNTY CLEANUP CREW, AND HE JOINS US LIVE WITH THE DETAILS. NATE. NIGEL. CAROL. THAT CREW SAYS THEY COULD BE HERE UNTIL HALLOWEEN, HAULING TENS OF THOUSANDS OF POUNDS OF TREE DEBRIS EVERY DAY. A SOUND THAT WILL SOON BE FAMILIAR FOR MANY IN THE UPSTATE. AS CLEANUP CONTINUES FROM HURRICANE HELENE. IT’S A DIFFERENT SOUND THAN THE ONE HEARD BY JIM FERGUSON’S FAMILY FRIDAY MORNING. WE ALL HEARD IT, FELT IT WHEN THE TREE FELL OVER AND HIT THE HOUSE. I’M STANDING NEXT TO ONE OF THE MASSIVE TRUCKS THAT IS HAULING AWAY TREE DEBRIS HERE IN GREENVILLE COUNTY, AND WITH THE YARD LIKE THIS HAVING POSSIBLY THOUSANDS OF POUNDS OF TREE DEBRIS THAT COULD MAKE A STREET LIKE THIS LIKELY A MULTI-DAY JOB LIKE BY NEXT WEEK YOU’LL HAVE ENOUGH TRUCKS HERE THAT A NEIGHBORHOOD LIKE THIS WILL GET PICKED UP IN, LIKE A DAY OR TWO DAYS. ROBBIE ROCHE, A CONTRACTOR HELPING WITH PICKUP, SAYS HELENE’S DAMAGE WAS HISTORIC, WITH ALL THE STORMS I’VE BEEN DOING, WHICH I’VE BEEN DOING FOR ABOUT 20 YEARS, PROBABLY BEEN TO AT LEAST 35 OF THEM, 36 OF THEM. THIS WAS A LOT OF DEVASTATION, A LOT OF BRUSH, A LOT OF TREES DOWN. AND NOW FOR THE FERGUSON’S. THE SOUND OF FALLING BRANCHES IS A SIGH OF RELIEF. IT’S GREAT TO SEE IT OUT OF HERE JUST BECAUSE IT’S ONE STEP BACK TOWARDS NORMALCY. WE CAN’T START TO REBUILD IT UNTIL IT’S ALL OUT OF HERE. THE LORD WAS WATCHING OUT FOR US ON THAT AND YOU KNOW, AGAIN, WE’RE JUST IT’S NOT A GREAT SITUATION, BUT WE’RE GRATEFUL. AND A REMINDER, THIS IS A FREE SERVICE FOR GREENVILLE COUNTY RESIDENTS. ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS COLLECT THAT TREE DEBRIS, PUT IT ON THE SIDE OF YOUR ROAD, SAVE ROOM FOR THOSE WORK VEHICLES, AND DON’T INCLUDE TRASH BAGS OR OTHER TRASH IN THAT PILE. REPORTIN GET LOCAL BREAKING NEWS ALERTS The latest breaking updates, delivered straight to your email inbox.
Your Email Address Submit Privacy Notice Advertisement Crews hard at work pulling tree debris from the sides of Greenville roads Over the next few weeks crews from around the U.S. will be in our area cleaning up damage left by Hurricane Helene
Share Copy Link Copy {copyShortcut} to copy Link copied! Updated: 11:18 PM EDT Oct 3, 2024 Nate Stanley Reporter The noise from heavy machinery and construction vehicles will soon be familiar to many in the upstate as clean-up continues after Hurricane Helene. It's a different sound than the one heard by Jim Ferguson's family Friday morning."We all heard it, felt it when the tree fell over and hit the house," he saidOn Thursday, a massive truck came through his neighborhood to clean the thousands of pounds of debris off of his yard. It's a free service that started this week by Greenville County, completely free to residents. According to the county, you can put your tree debris, without other trash or bags, along the side of your road, not blocking traffic, and a crew will come to pick it up. Assistant City Manager Hesha Gamble says it could take weeks to get to every home because of the extensive damage after Hurricane Helene.Robert Roche, a contractor helping with pick up, says Helene's damage was historic."With all the storms I've been to and been doing for about 20 years, probably been to at least 35, 36, this was a lot of devastation, a lot of brush, trees down," he said. "By next week, you'll have enough trucks that a neighborhood like this will get picked up in like a day or two."Now, for the Fergusons, the sound of falling branches is a sigh of relief."It's great to see it out of here. Just because it's one step back towards normalcy, we can't start to rebuild until it's all out," Jim Ferguson said. "The Lord was watching out for us on that, and, you know, again, we're just — it's not a great situation, but we're grateful." GREENVILLE, S.C. — The noise from heavy machinery and construction vehicles will soon be familiar to many in the upstate as clean-up continues after Hurricane Helene. It's a different sound than the one heard by Jim Ferguson's family Friday morning.
"We all heard it, felt it when the tree fell over and hit the house," he said
Advertisement On Thursday, a massive truck came through his neighborhood to clean the thousands of pounds of debris off of his yard. It's a free service that started this week by Greenville County, completely free to residents. According to the county, you can put your tree debris, without other trash or bags, along the side of your road, not blocking traffic, and a crew will come to pick it up. Assistant City Manager Hesha Gamble says it could take weeks to get to every home because of the extensive damage after Hurricane Helene.
Robert Roche, a contractor helping with pick up, says Helene's damage was historic.
"With all the storms I've been to and been doing for about 20 years, probably been to at least 35, 36, this was a lot of devastation, a lot of brush, trees down," he said. "By next week, you'll have enough trucks that a neighborhood like this will get picked up in like a day or two."
Now, for the Fergusons, the sound of falling branches is a sigh of relief.
"It's great to see it out of here. Just because it's one step back towards normalcy, we can't start to rebuild until it's all out," Jim Ferguson said. "The Lord was watching out for us on that, and, you know, again, we're just — it's not a great situation, but we're grateful."

author: الوطن
title: انقطاع خدمات الإنترنت عن كامل غزة
text:
أفادت وكالة «شهاب» الفلسطينية، اليوم (الخميس)، بانقطاع خدمات الإنترنت بالكامل عن جميع أنحاء قطاع غزة، في ظل الحرب الإسرائيلية المستمرة منذ أكتوبر (تشرين الأول) 2023.
ونقلت الوكالة عن الدفاع المدني بشمال غزة القول إنه يواجه صعوبة كبيرة في تحديد مواقع القصف بسبب انقطاع الإرسال وتعذر تواصل السكان معه.
وتشير أحدث إحصاءات لوزارة الصحة في غزة إلى ارتفاع إجمالي عدد قتلى الحرب الإسرائيلية على القطاع إلى 55 ألفاً و104، بينما زاد عدد المصابين إلى 127 ألفاً و394.
ويواجه قطاع غزة أزمة إنسانية حادة بعد 20 شهراً من الحرب المدمرة التي اندلعت بعد هجوم «حماس» على إسرائيل.
